word_mean: 产品在使用中由于自身质的变化导致产品丧失了预定的工作能力或其性能已劣化成不合格的状态。
设备执行所需功能的能力已经终止。失效标志着从一种状态变到另一种状态。失效之后，设备即有故障。

sentence.Network_en: Failure is never quite so frightening as regret do.
sentence.Network_cn: 比失败更令人恐惧的是懊悔。

sentence.Network_en: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.--Winston Churchill
sentence.Network_cn: 成功不是终点，失败也并非末日，最重要的是继续前进的勇气。

sentence.Network_en: It is the easy way out to blame others for our failure.
sentence.Network_cn: 把我们的失败归罪到别人头上倒是省事。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (originally as failer, in the senses 'non-occurrence' and 'cessation of supply'): from Anglo-Norman French failer for Old French faillir (see fail)

entry.def: Failure is a lack of success in doing or achieving something, especially in relation to a particular activity.

example.ex: This policy is doomed to failure...
Three attempts on the British 200-metre record also ended in failure.
example.tran: 对英国 200 米纪录发起的3 次冲击也均以失败而告终。

entry.def: If something is a failure, it is not a success.

example.ex: The marriage was a failure and they both wanted to be free of it...
example.tran: 他们的婚姻很失败，两人都想摆脱它。

example.ex: His six-year transition programme has by no means been a complete failure.
example.tran: 他的六年转型计划绝没有彻底失败。

entry.def: If you say that someone is a failure, you mean that they have not succeeded in a particular activity, or that they are unsuccessful at everything they do.

example.ex: Elgar received many honors and much acclaim and yet he often considered himself a failure...
example.tran: 人们对埃尔加赞誉有加，但他却常觉得自己是个失败者。

example.ex: I just felt I had been a failure in my personal life.
example.tran: 我就是觉得我的个人生活很失败。

entry.def: Your failure to do a particular thing is the fact that you do not do it, even though you were expected to do it.

example.ex: She accused the Foreign Office of disgraceful failure to support British citizens arrested overseas.
example.tran: 她指责说，外交部未能给在海外被捕的英国公民提供支持是可耻的。

example.ex: ...their failure to get the product mix right.
example.tran: 他们没有把产品组合弄对

entry.tran: (机器的)故障，失灵;(身体机能的)衰竭
entry.def: If there is a failure of something, for example a machine or part of the body, it goes wrong and stops working or developing properly.

example.ex: There were also several accidents mainly caused by engine failures on take-off...
example.tran: 还有几次事故主要是起飞时引擎出现故障造成的。

example.ex: He was being treated for kidney failure...
example.tran: 他因肾衰竭正在接受治疗。

entry.def: If there is a failure of a business or bank, it is no longer able to continue operating.

example.tran: 上个月倒闭公司的数量上升了 16％。

entry.def: If you say that someone has a failure of a particular quality or ability, you mean that they do not have enough of it.

example.ex: There is, too, a simple failure of imagination...
example.tran: 还有，就是纯粹缺乏想象力。

example.ex: He remained on his knees for a long time afterwards, ashamed by his failure of nerve.
example.tran: 他后来在地上跪了很久，为自己缺乏胆量而感到羞耻。

means.word_mean: 2. an event that does not accomplish its intended purpose;

sentences.sentence: "the surprise party was a complete failure"
"he felt that his entire life had been a failure"
"that year there was a crop failure"

means.word_mean: 4. a person with a record of failing; someone who loses consistently

sentences.sentence: "he resented my failure to return his call"
"the mechanic's failure to check the brakes"

means.word_mean: 6. inability to discharge all your debts as they come due;

sentences.sentence: "fraudulent loans led to the failure of many banks"

means.word_mean: 7. loss of ability to function normally;

auth_sentence.content: They're overplaying the danger of such a failure.

fail犯错误,欺骗→v.失败;n.&v.不及格

We can perhaps claim compensation from the steel suppliers for failure to deliver on time.

sentences.en: As a writer, he was a complete failure.
sentences.cn: 作为一个作家, 他是个完全失败的人。

jushi.chinese: 这家银行的破产在城里引起了恐慌。
